greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: If n > 1 is a k-th power with k >= 2 then a(n) = 0, otherwise a(n) = 1.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Given the Möbius function mu(n) = A008683(n), a(n) = abs(mu(n)) unless n is in A303946. - _Alonso del Arte_, May 28 2018
example: a(12) = 1 because 12 is not a perfect power (though it is divisible by a perfect power).
program: a132350 n = 1 - a075802 n  -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jun 14 2013
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 11 2007
